channel.title: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...
channel.description:
My current graphics card (an ASUS HD4850) is dying, so I need to replace it. I am hopeful that I might gain some useful input from people who know more about this sort of thing than I do on these forums.
The XFX HD5850 Black Edition:
First there's this cheaper one for £149.99:
[url]https://www.ebuyer.com/product/251995[/url]
Then there's this one, which seems to be the same card, just some some sort of box-like container around the card, yet it's £40 more expensive:
[url]https://www.ebuyer.com/product/241527[/url]
The Saphire HD5850:
[url]https://www.pixmania.co.uk/uk/uk/5122252/art/sapphire-technology/radeon-hd-5850-1-gb-gddr5.html?srcid=7226&Partenaire=pricerunner&CodePromo=oui#pix-review[/url]
[url]https://www.amazon.co.uk/Sapphire-HD5850-1GB-Graphics-Card/dp/B0036Z2F4U/ref=sr_1_2?s=computers&ie=UTF8&qid=1297480107&sr=1-2[/url]
What I don't get is, apart from the Saphire one, why is the XFX Black Edition HD5850 seemingly cheaper than normal non-overclocked 5850s on sites like Ebuyer? They're all around £200 or more, it seems a bit odd. I'm wondering what I'm missing.
Thanks in advance for any useful input. :slight_smile:

item.source: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...

item.title: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...
item.dc:creator: Metritutus
item.description:
I do not have a static-strap, but am aware of the risk of static damage. I’ve yet to break any computer component with static damage through installing/replacing various components, etc, including taking out the graphics card and BLOWING the dust off of it. :fffuuu:

Also I have a 650Watt Antec PSU.

Siggs:

Met, shoulda waited, then I coulda showed you this! I’m sure he’d ship outside of the US. I know, because I’ve bought from him, and he did for me.

https://www.nogripracing.com/forum/showthread.php?t=241975

Damn, would have only been around £110. Ah well, I was working to a deadline anyway as I wanted to get the card ordered to time with me returning home from University for a few days (I’m home now).

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...
item.dc:creator: p0rt1r
item.description:
if you dont have an antistatic wrist strap you gotta touch the side of the case (not the painted part) which is suprisingly difficult when your trying to install a cpu that cost you $700.

I hear touching the case only works if you have the powersupply plugged in to the wall but switched off so its only grounded.

item.source: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...

item.title: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...
item.dc:creator: p0rt1r
item.description:
ok the only words of advice i can offer is this. Dont skimp out on the psu because if u do you may very well be replacing it next month. A 450watt psu will barely cut it. My system is a c2q q9650, msi cyclone radeon 4890. My 450watt coolermaster psu is on the fence.

Look at case reviews before making a decision. Tomshardware is a good resource. Dont be scared to touch your motherboard. Just make sure your not wearing woolen clothes and you should be fine lol. (anti-static strap is a must have)

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...
item.dc:creator: Metritutus
item.description:
russilker:

Metritutus, thats quite a bit more than what it costs in the US, but the graphics card you bought is also considerably more expensive than it is here. But the NZXT phantom is probably one of the cheapest quality full-tower cases you can buy… and you don’t really want to buy a case with a PSU in it unless the case is made by Corsair or another quality PSU brand.

Yeah, I was avoiding cases with a PSU in when looking for a case with for this PC because I wanted to buy a decent PSU.

I will bear this case in mind though when I next look to build my own PC.

I guess prices in the UK just suck.

Read full topic

item.source: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...

item.title: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...
item.dc:creator: Metritutus
item.description:
Siggs:

£10?!! Damn Met, and i thought my case was cheap…

russilker:

Good choice getting the 6850 and passing on the older 5xxx series. I also recommend the NZXT Phantom, solid full-tower case and very cheap for what you’re getting.

It looks pretty good I’ll give it that, but it costs over £100! And it doesn’t seem to come with a PSU, and I thought that was what usually pushed case prices up. :brow:

I’m probably missing something important. It does seem to have a lot of slots for fans etc.

Siggs:

£10?!! Damn Met, and i thought my case was cheap…

I just checked and it looks like it was a little more, £13.99, so not quite as cheap as £10, but close.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...
item.dc:creator: Metritutus
item.description:
sersoft:

that’s just procrastination

I bought a decent case once and have been using it ever since.

I suppose you’re right. It just feels like it’ll be a real pain to take everything out and move it in to anew case, I’m always concerned I’ll damage something badly whilst moving things. I especially felt this when replacing the Motherboard.

I’ll see how things go with the new graphics card. If it doesn’t fit (even though it should) I’ll look in to getting a new case. If the temperatures are still bad, I’ll look in to getting a new case.

Hell…case recommendations anyone?

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics card - XFX HD5850 Black Edition or Saphire HD5850...
item.dc:creator: Metritutus
item.description:
xsantosis:

ATI Radeon HD 5970, the fastest graphics card in the world: https://www.amd.com/us/products/desktop/graphics/ati-radeon-hd-5000/hd-5970/Pages/ati-radeon-hd-5970-overview.aspx

PS: ATI FOREVER!!!

Mango Assassin:

XFX over Sapphire any day, Also, sort out your fucking cable management dude.

(Tip : I’d also say wait a few months, because there looking at releasing the 6990 and GTX 590, so prices may change again, IT DEPENDS.)

For size worry, I had my GTX 480 in my Antec 300.

[COLOR=‘Red’]SORT OUT THOSE FUCKING CABLES!!
:fffuuu::fffuuu::fffuuu::fffuuu::fffuuu::fffuuu:

EDIT : Also what case do you have? you can always move your hdd’s down.

I’ve got the cables tied up as best I can. The poor quality image makes it look worse than it is. For reference, I’ve got three hard drives plugged in to there.

This is my case, it’s no longer available, I’ll try to find some more images:

https://www.ebuyer.com/product/128413

sersoft:

O I have an idea OP

get a new case

At some point, probably. I’ll definitely be spending more on the case for the next PC I eventually build.

Read full topic
